origin: Aberdeen and Angus Counties of Scotland
description: Polled (hornless), moderate frame size, excellent meat quality (nice marbling), and calving ease.
Polled (honless), moderate frame size, disease resistant, heat resistant, and hardiness.
Horned or polled (hornless), medium to large frame size, heavily muscled, excellent growth rate, good feed conversion, and late maturity.
Short horned or polled (hornless), excellent growth rate, good muscling, early puberty, amd calving ease.

color: Rust brown to deep rich red body with white on the face, crest, dewlap, underline, switch, and legs below the knee.
description: Horns that typically curve down beside the head, moderate frame size, broad head, good foraging ability, docile, and good fertility.
